p: The bioactive compounds in ginger that are responsible for the wide therapeutic window of ginger include gingerols (like shogaols, 6-, 8- and 10- gingerol), paradols, ketones, phenolic compounds (like 6-dehydrogingerdione, zingerone, quercetin, and gingerenone-A), terpenes (like α-curcumene, α-farnesene, β-bisabolene and β-sesquiphellandrene), esters, aldehydes, and alcohols [ 47].
